item.description:
Two players face off in Rush Hour Shift, with each trying to be the first to get their car to opponent's side of the playing area.

The game board represents a multi-lane highway with a number of trucks and cars scattered across the lanes. Each player starts with a hand of cards, and the cards let you either move vehicles, shift sections of the highway left or right, or both. Players alternate playing cards until someone moves off the far edge of the game board and wins.

Rush Hour Shift includes ten suggested set-ups.

item.description:
Abaku is a numeric game for 1 to 4 players, who are lovers of numbers, figures, calculations and games! Everyone who knows that one and one gives two can play it. Playing Abaku significantly improves your calculating skills, logical thinking and intuition.

The players are using playing tiles to create numeric operations on the playing board. Addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, squares and cubes of whole numbers and square and cube roots of whole numbers are allowed. The player wins over the other players – calculators thanks to the proper combination of each tile’s value and strategic use of premium squares on the playing board. The aim is to get more points than the others.
Numeric operations are created by adding (horizontally or vertically) one or more tiles to tiles already lying on the board. Newly created numeric operation must contain or adjoin one or more tiles lying on the board. Numeric operations must be legible from left to right and from top to the bottom.

Abaku is an effective supporting instrument for teaching mathematics.

item.description:
In each round of 10 Down, players are dealt ten cards. On their turn, they can swap one card at a time. The object is to create a sequenced run of cards from 1 to 10; that's a "10 Down" and you earn one point token! If you can create a color set, in order, of three or more cards (e.g., 7, 8, 9 yellow), you receive bonus tokens. The first player to collect ten points wins.

You may call your "10 Down" hand as soon as you get it, but you may want to press your luck and wait until you are able to build a color set of three or more cards to earn additional tokens. Keep in mind you never know when someone else is going to call. How long can you press your luck?

One player rolls two dice and choose two cards (from the deck of nine cards). First card along with one die determines first part of the ball flight. First card is always revealed so your opponent can see it. In the first part of the ball flight, only important thing is that the ball cross over the net on the opponent's side of court. On that point your opponent can try to intercept your shot with volley, it is part of his judgement. The second card that, in combination with second die, determines second part of the shot is concealed from your opponent. That card tells which kind of shot did you choose (long shot, dropshot ....). In this part, most important thing for defending player, is to "read opponent mind" to anticipate wich shot will he/she choose to play.

MZM – Midnight Zombie Marathon

When Crazy Earl told us that Aliens were coming, we did not believe him. That did not stop him though. He put all his supplies into the sewer to protect them from tractor beams. Little did we know, zombies would soon infest the sewers and slowly take over your town.

Run, Dive and Dash your way past Zombies in the sewers. Find the hidden treasures of gas and food and barter your way out of town. If you are lucky enough, you might even find old Earl or his crash test dummy in your fun and crazy adventures.

This 1-4 player game is rated 13+ and comes with an easy to play rule book and personal deck with unique zombies to plague your adventures.

Single Player:

Game play revolves around running through the sewers to collect enough gas and food to barter with so you can get a ride out of town. Sounds easy right? We recommend you try to be careful because there is a limited amount of cards in the deck. The zombies will pop out of you, give you hugs and then go back into the deck. This creates a fun, creative and fun horde mechanic that is both simple and exciting. Can you get all you need before you have nothing left but zombies left in your deck?

Multiplayer:

There is only one seat in Earl's truck, and with so many people buying for it, it is up to you to out collect your friends.

While this setup is designed to work much like single player mechanic wise. The cards are no longer discarded, but go back into the deck to provide nonstop fun. With only ten rounds, you need to collect all you can before your friends do. How can you do this? Simple, bet your friends during their turn to try to wrestle their cards away from them and into your personal pile. Once all the players have a single card of their own, betting opens up and allows you to bet, roll and do whatever it takes to win. Do not worry... The zombie horde is still trying to hug its way to your brains, but can you outpace them and wave goodbye to your friends?

Follow us here at:

www.ArchNemesisGames.com

Only the strongest pimp can claim the coveted Pimp Island. Pimp Island is made up of four distinct districts known as Chinatown, Trailer Park, Chalupa Village and The Ghetto. All four districts contain three territories each. These territories, in addition to the central territory and four beach territories, make up the entirety of Pimp Island. America’s Next Top Pimp is a dangerous game of manipulation. Be wary of other pimps trying to take control of the island. The power of your hoes may not suffice. You must use the Police, Cardinals, Drugs and other manipulative measures if you want a chance at victory and complete control of Pimp Island!

America's Next Top Pimp is played over a few or several pimp rounds. During each pimp round, one or more pimp fights will occur. When all but one player has played their last card, new cards will be drawn and a new pimp round will begin. At the beginning of each fight, the player with the fight marker will place it on a territory of his/her choosing. This will be the location for the next fight.

Players begin each round with 10 cards each (8 in a 2 or 3 player game.)

During a fight, players take turns placing cards in front of them, forming their pimp hand. A player’s pimp hand shows the value he/she will bring to the fight. When all players finish placing cards, the fight is over. The player with the highest total value in his/her pimp hand controls the territory. A new territory is chosen and another fight takes place.

In a game of 2 or 3 players, the first player to control four territories that all touch each other or 5 total territories wins the game. In a game of 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8 players, the first player to control an entire district, four territories that touch each other or 5 total territories wins the game.

Quiz game for 3+ players.

One player is chosen as quiz master, and will hand out 3-4 cards. He then pick a player to read and answer the questions on their card; the scoring is as follows:
2 point for a correct answer
1 point for a partial correct answer
0 point for a wrong or no answer

The winner is the one with most points.

The exact date is unknown, but the first editions was with pre-1948 spelling rules.

The most fascinating stories of humanity are passed generation by generation, surviving to time and space. Only those stronger, more prosperous, more enlightened, more wise will be remembered and will have their names stored in memory. You get to make your empire remains the pages of history? Will you be one more legend to remember?

In Legends of Empires, you take control of a civilization in the fight to be recognized as the largest empire in history. To win the game, you should invest in historical characters, build wonders, discovering new technologies , spread their faith in the world, and to maintain a military force able to protect their civilization, and all the resources are managed by dice.

ISB - The Indian School of Business - is a premier B-school (top 50 global schools as per Financial Times) and Atrium was designed to celebrate ISB's 10th anniversary and make players (re)live that experience.

To graduate from ISB requires 32 academic credits. However, there is more to ISB life than academics alone. The 1 year long flagship Post Graduate Program has parties, student clubs, networking opportunities etc. In Atrium, the objective is to get to 32 points through a combination of academic courses, clubs, parties, and life@ISB.

Based on die roll, players accumulate time which they can use to collect academic, personal, or networking hours. Hours are traded for courses, clubs, parties, and life@ISB cards in a race to be the first to get to 32 points

From the publisher's website (Translated from Dutch):
 Play with your favorite girl trio! The K3 board game is a real hit for kids that love K3. Try to collect as many K3 trios as you can by rolling the dice. Whoever collects the most K3 trios wins the game. Suited for kids ages 4 and up.

Star trails is a simple game for younger players. While playing children can learn about the solar system. The task to orbit the solar system with space shuttle and make photos of planets and asteroids.

Points are collected in two ways. The first way by reaching finish line (first gets 12 points, second 10, third 8 ...). Another way is to collect counters. Each counter brings 1 point. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.

Your old favorite book is now your new favorite game! In Bring Your Own Book, players take turns drawing prompts from the deck, then race to find the best phrase in their own book that satisfies the prompt. What's the tastiest “name for a candy bar” in that history textbook you're reading for school? How quickly can you find “lyrics from a country western song” in your dog-training guide? What kind of “advice for graduating seniors” will appear in your anthology of limericks?

In more detail, everyone has their own book and sits in a circle. The cards are placed face down, and the starting player has a one-minute timer. The starting player takes the top card off the deck, picks a prompt, and reads it aloud. Everyone except the Picker searches their book for text to match the prompt, sequential text of any length: a single word, half of a sentence, a whole sentence, multiple sentences, etc.

The first Seeker to find matching text announces "I've got it" and starts the timer. When the timer runs out (or every Seeker announces "I've got it"), each Seeker reads what they've found. Seekers who didn't find text in time open to a random page and read a random sentence from it. The Picker chooses their favorite submission and awards the card to that Reader. After each round, the person to the left of the last Picker starts the next round. Once any player holds three cards, everyone passes their book to the player on their left. This happens any time a player reaches three cards during the game. Thus, it can happen as many times as there are players.

The game proceeds until one player has collected the required number of cards and wins: with 5-7 players the first to 4 cards win; with 3-4 players the first to 5 cards win.

item.description:
What do Backgammon, Go, and Chess all have in common? They are board games that have stood the test of time. Built on simplicity but with potential for complexity these games provide a challenge for players at all levels. Tao of Peg is designed to use a combination of luck and strategy to win in a variety of ways. Tao of Peg is the perfect game for family fun or for more serious gaming nights.

The board and pegs are made of wood, and the board design is printed on a vinyl sheet and applied directly to a wooden base. The entire board is lightly coated with a protective varnish. Felt buttons are then added to the bottom corners to protect playing surfaces.

HOW TO PLAY:

Each player is dealt four cards. A player begins by discarding a card from their hand. The player then places a game piece in any space with the corresponding color on the board. The turns ends by the player drawing a new card from the pile.

In addition to the 100 colored playing cards (25 per colored quadrant), each set also has two types of wild cards. Players may play a wild card instead of a colored card. Red wild cards allow the player to remove any game piece in play and black wild cards allow the player to place a game piece anywhere on the board.

There are four different ways to win;

 make a row of 5 pegs anywhere on the board
 make a row of 4 pegs in a single quadrant
 place a peg in each corner of a single quadrant
 place a peg in each corner of the game board

This is a game for five players, but there are six figurines. Each player controls one figurine which represents one herbivore dinosaur. They move over one great valley in search for food and water. Winner is the player whose dinosaur eats most of the food (collects most counters). But, not everything is simple as it might seems so. More important thing of number of collected counters is their diversity!
The sixth figurine is tyrannosaurus. That figurine is moved by player when he/she finish move with his/her figurine. Tyrannosaurus is carnivore dinosaur, and if he gets him one juicy herbivore dinosaur, he eats it! (a player whose dinosaur is eaten is eliminatred)...this game is neverending race for various food and water counters, and running away from tyrannosaurus.

Each player has a 1 figurine - car. While driving through the streets players have to respect all traffic rules. In each round the player must take 2 counters, one type A and one type B. Counters are deployed throughout the city. In each subsequent round of the counters are in ever more distant streets. When 2 players are playing, 6 laps are driven. When 3 players are playing, 4 laps are driven. ... When 6 players are playing, 2 laps are driven.

With this game is very easy to learn all the important traffic rules.

item.description:
For Overlords of evil, doom, and sorrow, life is not fair. The local races, hackneyed halflings and dullard dwarves, fail to appreciate the time and toil that goes into perverting the laws of nature and defying death itself.

And now, after a few singed villages and poisoned wells, the locals are coming for you and your magical brethren. Stout Heroes of the land, mighty warriors and dexterous thieves, pious paladins and wily wizards, have banded together to bust down your gates and evict you from your dark castle.

Luckily, you are in contact with Dark Masters, beings man was not meant to know. They are ready to provide you dastardly traps, potent spells, and decaying corpses for reanimation, if you can demonstrate your bravery by facing the toughest Heroes.

Now it’s a competition to see which Overlord can withstand the siege. Well... you never liked your neighbors that much anyway.

Dark Dealings is a quick drafting and combat game for 1-6 players. You first draft Heroes, then use them to bid for the Defenses that will eventually be their downfall. Players then take turns flipping and fighting their previously drafted Heroes. The last Overlord standing is the winner!

item.description:
In Dreary Hamlet you will play as an adventurer caught in their weakest moment. In medieval England times are hard, and to feed your family you will be forced to trek into the countryside, where you hope to slay the mysterious beasts that seem to be plaguing the tiny town of Hamlet. You have heard tales of the wretched creatures regurgitated from the Hamletsmaw, and though travellers shout of their horror, they also whisper through drink-numbed lips of the treasures that may be found within their guts.

The aim of the game is simple; be the player with the most loot once every player is dead. The journey there is not such a simple one though.

Each round of gameplay consists of a day and night phase. Creatures are drawn from a deck and placed in a grid at the centre of the table, where during the day players will choose which to face. Many things will affect the outcome of this combat, such as ammunition type equipped, creature health, defence, and number of attacks, and player health and items. Combat is resolved through dice rolls, and if the player survives they may receive a loot reward. These rewards can be sold for gold, crafted into better items that will be worth more in the future, or eaten to stave off death.

While players have control during the day, once the sun sets and night settles across the land, the creatures in play will follow them back to camp, setting upon the doomed adventurers. No loot can be won during the chaos of night, leaving survival the only reward to a successful defence.

At the same time, all players are competing to become the richest hero, so back-stabbing, betrayal, theft, and murder will be in abundance. The most important thing to remember is that death is inevitable, so take joy in your friend's suffering, and race to meet them on the other side!

item.description:
We’ve all been there. Embarrassing slips of the tongue, wardrobe malfunctions, secret (and not-so-secret) workplace romances, accidental emails, bathroom mishaps, copy room shenanigans. Awkward Moment at Work is the party game that helps you play out those all-too-familiar moments — and show them who’s boss!

Each turn, players try to impress “the Decider” by submitting the best reaction to the awkward moment from their hands of cards.

Awkward Moment at Work is the adult version of Tiltfactor's award-winning card game Awkward Moment. While the game’s awkward workplace situations may be unfamiliar to kids and teens, the game is family friendly (contains nothing you wouldn’t see in a PG-13 movie).

A Steampunk Card Game of Adventure Across the Multiverse.

Imagine, beyond the bounds of your world that there are in fact several worlds, several Alternate Realities. Each more fantastic than the last all given life and connected by the pure power of thought, creativity, and terror harnessed in a mystical energy source called "Aether". These Realities exist tethered together in a tumultuous ever growing and ever changing Multiverse. While most worlds are blissfully ignorant many know of it's existence and even travel between the Realities seeking knowledge, riches or power.

Twisted Skies is a Steampunk card game of Adventure and Intrigue set in the fabulous adventures of the AIRSHIP ISABELLA. Players cooperate to complete daring missions at the start of the game but will double cross and challenge each other as they near victory. Can you master the Steampunk Multiverse?

Players take control of an elite airship. By manning and equipping the ship and crew, players take turns attempting to complete mission cards in an attempt to earn enough Victory Points to win. Other players can try to Interrupt the current player from succeeding at a mission, or can form alliances to help each other.

Twisted Skies is played in a sequence of Phases that make up each player’s turn. Players take their turns one at a time proceeding clockwise around a table. The active player taking
their turn is known as the Mission Attempter The Sequence of play for the phases of a turn are as follows:

1. Ready all Exhausted Cards
2. Draw one Manifest Card
3. First Drop. Place one Crew card into play or Equip a Tech card
4. Open Trading. Players openly trade cards with the Mission Attempter
5. Draw one Catalyst Card. If it is a Mission Card place it on the Table.
6. Mission Attempt. The Mission Attempter tries to gain points by completing Missions.
7. Pirate Trading. Players blindly trade cards from their hands with the Mission Attempter
8. Second Drop. Place one Crew card into play or Equip a Tech card

Once a player has made the Second Drop (and resolved any effect of that Drop) then their turn is over.

The vast and powerful Red Fork Empire! Elder juggernaut of the Steampunk Multiverse! This special standalone edition of Twisted Skies features the thrilling, bizarre, and adventurous citizens of the Empire as they battle their ancient enemy The Dull with the power of Creativity! This set can be played as its own special set or it can be integrated with other sets and expansions of Twisted Skies to bring the wonder of the Red Fork Empire to your games of Twisted Skies!

Dune: The Dice Game is a dice-driven game set in the Dune Universe created by Frank Herbert. The players represent various Factions vying for control of Arrakis, the desert planet. Each of the 8 playable Factions has a small set of thematical special abilities that allow them to break certain rules in the game.

Each turn, you will need to politicize, ally and employ the means of Kanly wisely, recruit new troops, ship them to the surface, and attack in just the right spot. Fate, in the form of the dice, can be controlled to a certain degree but still might thwart your plans; Sandstorms and the mighty Shai-Hulud plague the surface of Arrakis; A charismatic leader might tip the balance in a forlorn combat in your favour.

The game ends when one Faction or Alliance is in control of a certain number of Arrakis’ strategic Regions at the end of their turn, or after 6 whole rounds.

Inspired by and based on both, this game tries to find a middle ground between the complexity and duration of Dune and the excessive simplicity of Dune Express while staying true to former’s general feel and steering closer to the lore of the original novels than both. Sounds a bit ambitious, I know.

item.description:
In a distant kingdom, the royal palace is in turmoil. After one of the king's tasters dies of poisoning, the king no longer knows who to trust within his closest circle of confidants.

There is the Queen, who he married to secure the relationship with the neighboring kingdom, but who does not share the love he has for her. Their daughter, the Princess, next in line to inherent the crown and friends with enemies of the king. The Bishop, who has spoken aloud that the king should be replaced by a spiritual leader. The Knight, just back from war with the neighboring kingdom and in a rage that the war had ended through marriage and not bloodshed. The Rook, who has become senile in his old age and now wandering the halls of the castle aimlessly. And the Pawn, ready to rise up in the ranks of the royalty by any means necessary.

Can you help protect the king through the seasons of time and ensure that he remains atop his throne? Or will the tyrants prevail and take his crown from you?

En Passant (from French: in passing) is a special move in chess that allows an opponent to capture another pawn "as it passes" which was the inspiration for this game.

In this 16-card playing card game each player is dealt four cards. The player with the King card in their hand goes first. Starting with that player, each player plays a card and performs the action listed. For example, one card may have you steal another players card. Or another card may have everyone pass their hands to the player on their left.

Your goal is to keep track of the King Card as he travels from player to player. Once someone is only left with one card the round ends and the player with the King Card gets a point. The first player to 3 points wins the game.

item.description:
This card game is based on the game theory of the Prisoner's Dilemma. The theory explores why two purely "rational" individuals might not cooperate, even if it is in their best interest to do so.

In the prisoner's dilemma story, two prisoners are separated and have the option to confess to the crime or deny any involvement. If both prisoners confess, they will get 2 years. If one confesses and other denies involvement, the one who confesses will get 10 years. If they both deny involvement they both get 3 years.

When the story plays out, the prisoner's choose their self interest over the risk of possibly getting less jail time if they both confess.

Our card game uses that same idea but expands on it to allow for up to 5 prisoners and includes some added incentives to keep things interesting.

PLAYING

Each player draws an Incentive Card, looks at it and places it face down in front of them. Dice are rolled and placed on the Jail Card and Reward Card. Each player selects a Color Card from their hand and plays it face down in front of them. The Witness Color Card is turned over so that everyone can see the color. All players reveal their Color Card and Incentive Card at the same time.

Starting with the player color card who matches the Witness, any player who can play a Incentive Card decides how to use it: Alibi, Bribe, Double-Cross, Bully, Outsmart, Threaten.

Colors Cards are counted up by color. The player whose color has the most cards gets negative points matching the die on the jail card. The player whose color has the least cards gets positive points matching the die on the reward card. If there is a tie, all of the tying players each receive the negative points.

Points are recorded for each player and the round is over and everything starts over again.

First player to 21 points wins.

name.value: Memory Game at the Friendly Farm
Jeu de Mémoire: La Ferme de Foin-Foin

item.description:
A new king of memory game, educational and more fun to play than conventional games, sure to please the youngest to the oldest players! Two ways to play for twice as much fun: combine identical pairs of picture discs or trios of discs identified with pictograms.

With this two-for-one game, children will learn about the Friendly Farmer's daily activities and develop their visual memory while establishing a foundation for reading and learning a second language.

Note: Discs illustrating activities contain no text, giving children free rein to their imagination and creativity.

From the back of the box:

Jeu de mémoire.

Un jeu de mémoire nouveau genre, plus amusant et éducatif que les jeux traditionnels, qui plaira aux tout-petits et aux plus grands! Deux façons de jouer pour deux fois plus de plaisir: en jumelant des paires de pastilles identiques ou en associant des trios identifiés par des pictogrammes.

Shiv - a game of incarceration and blood - is a 3 player micro-game where players control prison gangs vying for influence by offing other in-mates.

Each player has a unique hand of 7 gang members that they will deploy face-down to one of three locations. Players perform actions listed on their cards as well as locations as they attempt to bluff, maneuver, and shiv the opposition.

Intrigue and drama are the focus as player's target influential members of the opposition's gang and claw for power while limiting their exposure.

Social, dynamic, and completely devoted to theme there is no other micro-game like Shiv.

item.description:
Intended for families who enjoy strategy-based games, PaNiC STaTioNS is a card game suitable for 2 to 4 players age 8 to 80.

The cards are first set out in a square to form the playing area. Some of the cards are kept back to ensure that it is more difficult to predict what you will land on. The cards are initially face-down and Tokens are placed on the cards.

The aim of the game is to collect 10 Tokens and then be the player who turns the last card face-up.

Each player has two Pawns which are moved around the cards according to the role of two dice. During the first phase of the game Tokens are collected when a player lands on the cards. The card is then turned face-up and any instructions followed. For example it could be a "Booby-Trap" card which forces your Pawn out of play. In which case you need to roll a 6 to bring it back in to play.

During the second phase of the game most of the Cards will have been turned-face up and most of the Tokens collected. It now becomes more important to keep both Pawns in play to give you some flexibility in choosing which cards you land on. You and your rivals will be trying to force Pawns out of play, trying to steal Tokens, and generally attempting to turn the last card face-up. The cards have various effects which assist (or hinder) you in this. Many of the cards interact with each other. For example if a rival's Pawn is on the "Philanthropy" card (which obliges him to give away 2 Tokens every time somebody else's Pawn goes out of play) it could be a good move to land on "Maelstrom" which forces all Pawns out of play. Most of the cards have effects that can be used to advantage in this way.
Each turn you also have the option of rolling the "Panic Die" which gives you other alternatives. You may choose to do this, for example, if your initial dice roll was particularly disadvantageous of if another player is about to win. You do however have the chance of losing half your Tokens - but even this can be turned to your advantage if you realise how.

item.description:
Materials

25 square tiles that are dark on one side and light on the other 
4 Othello disks, two of the disks are marked on their dark and light sides with a red dot at their centers.

Setup

Arrange the 25 tiles, light side up, into a 5x5 grid. Next place the two disks with the red dots light side up on two diagonally opposed corner tiles, do the same for the remaining two disks.

Play

One player plays with the two disks that have the red dots and the other player the two without.

Decide who goes first in any convenient manner, turns then alternate.

On a turn, you must,

1) Move one of your disks one space either diagonally or orthogonally onto an empty tile and then

2) Flip an empty light sided tile that is orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to the disk last moved or remove an empty dark sided tile that is orthogonally or diagonally adjacent to the disk last moved.
 Restrictions

- A light sided disk moves on empty light sided tiles and after a move you must flip an adjacent light sided tile to its dark side.

- A light sided disk may be moved to a dark sided tile by flipping the disk to its dark side and after the move you must remove an adjacent dark sided tile from the board. From this point on the disk is a dark sided disk and cannot be flipped back.

- A dark-sided disk moves only on empty dark sided tiles and after the move you must remove an adjacent dark sided tile from the board.

Object

The player last to move wins.
Choose your horse, roll the dice. A race to the finish line.

item.description:
2GM Tactics is a full-fledged strategy card war-game where units are represented by cards and you’ll be in command of your army. You’ll have to build your deck to achieve the goals you’ve been tasked for. Gear up your troops for the battle; deploy all type of units: armor, artillery and transport units; request air support and deceive your enemy. Lead Patton or Rommel to the final victory; seize buildings; destroy your enemy and conquer the battlefield! Play historical scenarios: go ashore in Normandy, defend Monte Cassino or dig in the Ardennes!

You can play 2GM TWG in two ways. You can play a “Battle Royal” - players will establish a number of points, they will set up the battlefield prior commencing the battle and the goal is to destroy your opponent’s Head Quarter; or you can play a “Scenario” – historical or not – with a predefined set of rules to deploy units and the terrain, and pre-established conditions of victory.

In a player’s turn you’ll gain a number of “Action Points” that will be used to deploy new units on the battlefield and to employ other supporting cards. These Action Points will increase by several ways as the game evolves.

“Objectives” to achieve the victory during a game are very diverse: from destroying your opponent’s HQ to capture the battlefield or inflict a specific number of kills to your enemy. Seizing or bombing a building, capturing enemy’s supplies, rescue a flag objective or hold a position for a number of turns are other ways to achieve the victory.

The game includes three different decks: one for the American Army, one for the German Army and a third double-sided deck to represent different types of Terrain.

Each side’s deck is composed by cards representing unique types of units and supporting cards. Different types of units - infantry, vehicle, armor, aircraft and transport -, all with their own specific capabilities and with additional equipment to be deployed.

Supporting cards are assorted: you may find “Equipment”, “Promotion”, “Mines”, and “Diversion”, among others.

Terrain deck includes anything that is needed to make every single battle a unique experience.

Additionally, you´ll find Help and Summary cards along with Flag Generals that will improve your army with their command abilities; 2d10 and more than 100 counters (damage counters, victory points, etc.) and additional equipment to gear up our units depending on the situation.

item.description:
In Fliegende Zeilen, players have to create new texts (e.g. a poem or commercial slogan), based on lines from famous poetry.

First, the type of text is picked, than the quote for inspiration is determined randomly. In a limited timeframe, players compete to produce the wittiest text, awarding points to the creations of the others. Highest total wins.

Letter Chess is a solitaire word game that combines Word Search and Chess. Players move letters like Chess pieces to string together words that connect horizontally, vertically and diagonally on a 7-by-9 grid. To score big assemble long words and make sure you have a end of game strategy to clear the board.

Setup: 48 Letter tiles are randomized on a 7-by-9 grid. At the start of the game there are 15 empty squares near the center of the board. The center horizontal row is always empty. Bordering the center row, two rows are made up of four empty squares and three letter squares (like a parapet which is the alternate name). Use any word game you may own to play the game.

Game Mechanics: The main object of the game is to assemble words on the grid. Eligible words must have letters connected on the board horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. Acceptable words must be at least three letters long. Words cannot be played more than once per game and proper nouns are not allowed. Individual letter tiles cannot be used twice in the same word (such as “o” twice to spell book or “d” to spell dad).

During a single turn, a player can move multiple letters together to construct words. All letters moved during a turn must be used to construct a word that round. Consonants can move any number of squares horizontally, vertically or diagonally (like a Queen in Chess) to an empty square. When moved, however, consonants cannot jump over other letters. Vowels can move two squares horizontally and one square vertically, or two squares vertically and one square horizontally (like a Knight in Chess) to an empty square. Unlike consonants, vowels can jump over other letters. After a word is constructed those letter tiles are removed from the board and play continues. The game ends when all letters have been used or no more plays are left. Lastly, the letter “Y” moves as a consonant even if used as a vowel.

Scoring: Letter Chess uses simple formulas to tally a score at the end of the game. So when playing keep a pencil and paper nearby. Vowels count as 2 points and Consonants count as 1 point. The letter “Y” counts as one point even if used as a vowel. A word is tallied by multiplying the letter score by the letter count. For example, “murals” has a tally of forty because there is a letter score of eight (two vowels and four consonants) and a letter count of five (8x5=40). There is a bonus score when all the letters are cleared from the board. The bonus is calculated by multiplying the number of rounds by 10 and subtracting that amount from 200 (arbitrary number). For example, a whole board was cleared in twelve rounds then 200-(12X10)= 80 points. When letters remain on the board with no more moves left those letters are tallied as a word and subtracted from the score. For example if the letters “I, X and O” remain on the board. The letter score is 5 and letter count is 3 which equals 15 minus points.

At most there are 16 rounds per game assuming all words are 3-letters long. In Letter Chess, a high score is in the 400’s and a low score is around 200.

Customer Clues is a re-theme of Clue distributed to U.S. Bank Employees as a training tool. It plays nearly the same as Clue, but adds a deck of Mystery Product Cards. These cards have questions about bank products, sales techniques, etc. that must be answered when players land on certain marked spaces on the board.

Like Clue, players move from room to room making guesses as to the cards in the mystery envelope, but in this rethemed version they move around a bank branch, and must deduce which product was sold to which customer in which room. As mentioned above, as players move around the board, they may land on spaces which will force them to answer questions about bank accounts, policies and procedures.

Description from the Box:
Be the best at word building! Stack your Spelligator with as many words as you can to win! Challenge your friends to see who can build the highest stack of words!


Spelligator is a children's game designed to teach simple vocabulary, spelling and phonics. Each player has a plastic "Spelligator" with three shaped spaces on its back. Players then take turns turning over letter tiles, each of which can fit only in the beginning, middle or end space. Each tile is printed with either a single letter, a blend or a digraph. If the player can add the tile to his or her Spelligator's back to make a new word, it is added. If not, the tile is turned back face down. When all the tiles are used or no more words can be made, the player with the highest stack on his or her Spelligator's back wins.

item.description: Find the Rhyme is an educational matching game for young children, designed to teach the concept of rhyme. The game consists of 20 pairs of rhyming picture cards, each of which is cut like a puzzle piece on one edge, so that each card only fits with its designated pair, and when fit together will form a rhyming phrase (e.g. "a dragon in a wagon"). Anywhere from six to twenty left-side cards are laid out in a line. Each player takes a turn choosing a right-side card and trying to match it with one left-side card to make a rhyme. If the match is correct, the player keeps the pair. If not, the tile is returned. Play continues until all pairs are matched and the player with the most pairs wins.

Mouse-O-Mania is a roll-and-move game included as a pull-out insert in the children's book "Geronimo Stilton: A Christmas Tale." Players must roll dice and move along a track, trying to get Geronimo Stilton to his Christmas party. Along the way, players land on spaces referring to events in the book. These spaces may move them forward or back or cause them to gain or lose turns. The first player to get Geronimo Stilton to his Christmas party by landing on the end of the track by an exact roll wins.

Build a lemonade stand and let it flourish or flounder with Lemonade Stand Board Game. 2 to 6 players can learn the basics of business by caring for their own virtual lemonade stand. Kids can purchase their own ingredients, set their own prices, and choose a location for their business. As they move across the board, they'll face challenges like weather, advertising, and customer experience. A fun game for the whole family. Includes instructions, dice, cards, and boards. Ages 7 and up.

All players begin the game by building their virtual Lemonade Stand and buying ingredients to make lemonade to sell
As players move around the board they learn about the many factors in running a business
Learning that it's all about location, advertising, weather, selling price & customer experience
Fun for kids and parents

The Kenya Safari Game is a roll-and-move game that simulates a traveler exploring the sights and tourist attractions of Kenya. Players start from a pre-chosen base in the capital city of Nairobi. They draw a variety of different-colored cards, each of which represents a different type of site or tourist attraction they must visit or an animal they must photograph on safari. They then roll two dice each turn to move around the board by a roads, trails, trains and airplanes to visit the required locations. The first player to complete all their photography assignments and see all their designated sights returns to his or her Nairobi base and is declared the winner. Special rules allow players to take flights or extra turns when rolling doubles.

Although this is primarily a roll and move game an element of strategy is introduced by the fact that players must visit a variety of sites in a variety of areas and may travel by various routes. Players who plan the most efficient routes from place to place may gain an advantage.

link.value: The East African Wild Life Society

item.description:
The goal is to be the first player to get all his ten stones to the opposite side of the board. One player moves his stones from to left to right, the other from bottom to top.

Two dice are thrown and the sum of both may be used for one dice or the separate numbers for two. When you end your move on top of your opponent's stone, that stone is moved back to its starting position.

Uprising is a game for two players that depicts, in a very abstract way, the growth and development (or containment and suffocation) of a popular movement in revolt against an oppressive government. The Rebel player, who starts the game with little apparent power but a great deal of information, is in conflict with the Government player, who has power (with his assortment of Agents) but very little information on the Rebel’s resources and capabilities.

The pieces represent small groups (Insurgents and Agents), support organizations (Sympathizers), and nonexistent things or misleading information (Dummies).

The map (a field of 91 hexes) is perhaps the most abstracted part of the design, in that it does not represent physical distance, but something more like organizational proximity. With the Rebel pieces starting on the outer perimeter, and the Agents starting in a tight group around the Nexus, it can be displayed how far the revolt must go and how much larger it must grow in order to challenge the government for ultimate power. However, being out in the margins allows time to organize and gather strength....

This game depicts, in a very abstract way, the essence of insurgent warfare. The game is for two players, the State (representing the existing government or leadership of a country or organization) and the Insurgent (representing the opposition to that government or leadership). The State has powerful forces but little information; the Insurgent has complete information but little actual power. Whichever side overcomes its disadvantage wins (the State by gaining information on the Insurgents and killing them; the Insurgents by penetrating to the centre of State power).

The Insurgent wins by capturing the Capital. This is accomplished by having, at the end of any his player-turns, Insurgent pieces occupying either four connected spaces in the Inner Circle (that is, there are at least four Insurgent-occupied spaces in the Inner Circle that also share a border with one or two other Insurgent-occupied spaces in the Inner Circle), or occupying any six of the twelve spaces of the Inner Circle.

The State player wins by killing 12 Insurgent pieces (so making an Insurgent victory impossible).

Originally designed in 2011 for an online game site, from an idea by Michael Freeman.

A variation of Fan Tan. 54 cards; 1-9 in 5 colours / 3 'joker cards' / 6 'give or take 2 cards'. On a turn, a player either plays a card or draws a card. Played cards are placed on the table next to previously placed cards. The new card has to be of an immediately higher or lower value and of the same suit, or it has to be of the same value and from another suit. Players can only play 1 card per turn. A joker card can be played at any time and at any place while a 'give or take 2 card' (used to have another player take 1 or 2 extra cards or to remove 1 or 2 cards from the table) can be played at any time except as a player's last card. When a 'give or take 2 card' is played it goes back into the stack of cards and the stack is shuffled again. The first player to have no card left wins.

item.description:
Plant. Grow. Harvest. Sell. Farmers Market is a game themed around supplying customers with what they desire at the local farmers market. During the game, players will plant corn, wheat grain, potatoes seeds, wait for them to grow so they can harvest them. Milk can be drawn from Cows, and the rare chicken can also be found annoying the players if they don't supply a customer who needs one or build a coop. After the goods are ready, they can be transported to the River Street Farmers Market for consumption.

Other options in the game include advancing the technology to get a greater harvest, adding Chickens to a Coop, planting long-growing watermelons (the hit of the day), and attending State Fairs, entering your vegetables into the largest such and such competition (in theme only).

Deck manipulation is the main mechanism in farmers market. Players each have their own deck of staple cards. Unlike a normal deck builder, during the game, only a few cards will be added to their deck (plant), and most that have been added will also be removed the next time it shows up (growth-to-harvest). More of a Deck Freeloader system or cards "just passing through" the Deck.

If you are not familiar with the Bible Master card game, it is an easy to learn card game designed to challenge your knowledge of Scripture.

Players win verse cards by filling in the blanks with word cards like the ones below. Action cards keep the game challenging with wild cards, skips and more! The winner is the player with the most verse cards at the end of the game.

Our first version “Salvation” includes Bible verses focused on the Gospel. As your family plays, you are reinforcing Scripture memory in a fun yet challenging way.

There are 12 verse cards, 14 action cards and 28 word cards in the 54 card deck.

Why the Salvation theme?

1 Peter 3:15 says, "But sanctify the Lord God in your hearts: and be ready always to give an answer to every man that asketh you a reason of the hope that is in you with meekness and fear:"

Through testing the game play I learned that there are some Christians who have been Christians for years that don't know some of the foundational scriptures used in this game.

My goal is to help players of all ages be ready to share the hope of the Gospel by helping them memorize scriptures that will allow them to share their faith with confidence.

The initial production run will be in the King James version. Though others may be available in the future.

name.value: The Most Princess in the World

item.description:
User summary:

The players are all princesses wanting to become the most princess princess in the world. They must collect accessories, dresses and education so that they will gain fame from being rescued by heroes when the demon lords attack. They also need to watch out for weight-gaining food and tea parties, and be careful not to nag too much.

The game centers around making "negative" bids for the available cards for the current round. Players bet "nagging points" to gain the card they want; however these nagging points are negative VP.

When someone gains a demon lord card, all players are captured and the game is interrupted by a hero rescue auction, in which the players bid for what hero to be rescued by. Depending on the hero and the player's stats, players will gain fame by being rescued. When three demon lords have been defeated, the game ends and the player with the most points wins.

Channeling is a game of tactical spellcasting. Each match represents a battle between channeling wizards - be it a schoolyard quarrel at the academy, the real stakes struggle of a magical war or a grand clash on the very edges of reality.

The players draw cards from a standard decks full of basic spells, but each sorcery cast and summoned magical entity becomes unique combination between its original form and the channeling abilities of the caster.

There are different modes of play - in the most basic one that's recommended for learning, each player may cast trough the four basic elemental channels (Flame, Rock, Frost and Lightning) before dabbling in asymmetrical duels where the same elements are randomly drawn and duels utilizing advanced channels and player powers.

item.description:
From the instructions:
"Vowel Bingo is a fun-filled way to strengthen and reinforce vowel skills. Each playing card contains eight labeled illustrations of objects having long or short vowel sounds in their names. The purpose of game play is to match each object's game with its correct vowel."

Vowel Bingo is similar to standard bingo, but in order to place their markers, players must know and match short and long vowel sounds. Each player has a card with as series of pictures labeled with the corresponding words. The caller calls out a vowel sound--long a, for example--and players must search their card for a word/picture with a long a in the word. When a player has a complete row, their card is checked by the caller to make sure the vowels are identified correctly. If so, the player wins. If not, play continues until someone has a correct row.

BACKGROUND: The Falklands Ablaze is a solitaire semi-historical simulation of the Falklands War (May – June 1982). The Game begins shortly after the Argentinians capture the Port City of Stanley after a surprise attack. The British have mustered their Task Forces and have arrived just of the northern coast of the Falkland Islands. The British must now establish a Beach Head and advance their forces towards Port Stanley to defeat the Argentinian Forces and liberate the British Settlers.

OBJECTIVE: As the Commander of the British Naval and Land Forces, you must gather your forces and naval squadrons to capture Port Stanley, Port Stanley Airfield and 10 other Argentine controlled Settlements before the Campaign Deck is depleted.

GAME FEATURES: The Falklands Ablaze contains many colorful counters including ground forces, ships and aircraft. The Game includes rules for Ground, Sea and Air Combat.

The Falklands Ablaze can be found at the following URL:
http://www.berserkergames.net

Wallachia 20 features two complete games covering a pair of important major battles fought during the Russo-Turkish War of 1806 – 1812 for control of the key Danube river port of Rousse in the province of Wallachia.

Rousse 20 simulates the earlier of these two engagements, fought on 22 June, 1811. In this battle Ottoman forces advanced northwards, towards the present day Bulgarian-Romanian frontier. Russian infantry and cannons were able to stall the polyglot Ottoman army, and although they managed to eke out a marginal victory their commander, General Kutuzov, chose to yield the key town of Rousse to the Ottomans, convincing them they had won a great victory. The Czar was not pleased.

Slobozia 20 focuses on the latter battle of 2 October 1811. In this engagement Kutuzov conducted a surprise march which cut off and surrounded the bulk of the Ottoman army, trapping it on the northern (Bulgarian) shore of the Danube. The result was a decisive Russian victory that permitted negotiations to end the war. This had the dual advantage of allowing Russia to transfer key reserves to oppose Napoleon’s invasion of Russia in 1812, and also prevented Austria from contributing more forces to support the French invasion.

The Gallows are ready! Mages accused of wickedness are prepared to meet their end. It's high noon and yet the sky darkens as if it too knows what the future brings. Today, all of mages on the gallows will face their final fate. One by one the wicked will be executed until only one remains...

...and you want that one remaining to be your client. That's right you're a lawyer and the mage you are protecting is a secret. Your job is to protect your mage by making sure all the other mages on the gallows are executed first. Of course, the other lawyers are also secretly protecting one of the mages.

In The Gallows each player is secretly defending one of the characters in the center. On your turn you add one vote token to any character and then move one vote token from a character to a different character. Once a character has enough votes they are executed. Whoever had the most votes on a character when they are executed scores the conviction worth one point. When only one character remains in the middle, whoever was protecting them scores an acquittal worth lots of points.

Play consists of players trying to manipulate the votes so they score convictions and prevent their own defendant from getting convicted.

name.value: The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove

item.description:
The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove is a fast-paced, light-hearted card game for two or more players. You and your increasingly mighty party of adventuring companions have spent all day slogging through the dungeon, killing monsters and taking their stuff. Now you’re back in town, healed up, cleaned up, and ready to party at the Red Dragon Inn. Drink, gamble, and roughhouse with your friends. But don’t forget to keep an eye on your gold. If you run out, you’ll have to spend the night in the stables. Oh… and try not to get too beaten up or too drunk. If you black out, your friends will continue the party without you… after they loot your body for gold, of course! The last conscious adventurer with gold wins the game!

The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove is a standalone game for 2-4 players. It expands on "The Red Dragon Inn" family of box sets and single-character expansions called Allies. You can mix and match characters from any of these sets, letting you build the party composition of your choice! Each of the box sets includes four unique characters, a drink deck, gold pieces, and all the parts for 2-4 players to play right out of the box. Each of the Allies expansions includes a character deck as well as gold pieces and bits so you can add another character to a box set (thus making a 2-4 player collection playable by 2-5 players).

Sera the Fleetfooted: Sera is a stealthy rogue whose speed and agility allow her to take down roomfuls of bad guys before they even know what’s happening. The dungeon’s beefiest monsters are no match for her flying daggers! She didn’t get so skilled by slacking off, though. Even while she’s partying, she continues training to make sure she’s always at the top of her game.


 The Good: She hones her skills by sparring with her friends.
 The Bad: Sometimes she does this without warning them first…


Lizwick the Collector: Lizwick is a consummate problem solver with an unrivaled collection of gear. Her wondrous Bag of Holding contains rare and peculiar items of all descriptions. She is always on the lookout for the next amazing whatchamacallit to add to her collection. Lizwick has gotten The Party out of many a jam with the clever application of the wrong tool at the right time.


 The Good: Lizwick’s collection is the envy of academies, guilds and hoarders alike!
 The Bad: …and they’d like their stuff back.


Joran the Trickster: Joran’s penchant for pranks earned him a student “sabbatical” from the Mage’s Collegium. Fortunately, Zot saw some potential in the boy, and decided to take him adventuring for some valuable field experience. The young mage’s humor has proven to be mostly harmless to his new friends. He puts his clever brain to good use by pulling fast ones on the bad guys.


 The Good: Joran’s talent for misdirection makes him the perfect weapon against enemy spell-casters.
 The Bad: It also makes him the perfect weapon against his friends’ gold, their sobriety, their patience…


Zakhan the Drunken Master: Zakhan’s father is a solemn elven noble and a guru of meditative martial combat techniques. His mother was a rowdy barbarian warchief with a penchant for throwing wild parties. This unique heritage has allowed Zakhan to hone a seemingly reckless hybrid fighting style of his own. His opponents who underestimate his “drunken” martial arts do so at their own peril!


 The Good: Zakhan’s drunken fighting techniques make him a formidable foe.
 The Bad: Sometimes he’s actually just drunk.


But wait, there's more! The Red Dragon Inn 5: The Character Trove is also a massive storage solution for all previous sets (with room for more). You get a massive storage box plus dividers, new play mats for all previously released characters, updated tokens and more! Check it out:


 6 Unique Decks (4 40-card Character Decks, 1 18-card Item Deck, 1 30-card Drink Deck)
 29 Character-specific Player Mats (with replacements for all previous sets!)
 35 Cardboard Deck Dividers
 1 Cardboard Chi Marker
 4 Glass Fortitude Markers
 4 Glass Alcohol Content Markers
 9 Remastered Cardboard Fortitude Markers
 9 Remastered Cardboard Alcohol Content Markers
 55 Remastered Gold Coin Tokens
 9 New Platinum Coin Tokens
 10 Foam Spacer Blocks
 2 Cloth Drawstring Bags
 Ziptop Baggies
 Rules for playing The Red Dragon Inn

item.description:
The boardgames sets in the Small City trilogy and expands the concepts of the game in the future.

Arcology is a 3D city boardgame that adds the mechanisms of Small City to the game Town Center already released in 2012-2013-2014

The game is divided into 8 seasons where the players try to raise the highest city by minimizing the pollution generated by the factories. To the concept of adjacency already developed in Card City and Town Center, the players will use the Residential-Shops-Leisure cubes in order to host the most citizens as possible...

Players will also allocate a job to their citizens and will move them in the 3D structure...

As in Yatzee you throw five dice. You can throw each die 3 times and you score by getting certain combinations.

In Star Wars Yatzy you don´t have a fixed set of combinations, but instead you draw mission cards. Each player have two mission cards and they draw a new if they have less than 2 cards. you dicard a card if you finish a mission. If you don´t use all your throws you can add one mission card.

When one player have finished 8 missions the game ends and the player with most points wins.

Buy, buy, buy at every location, location, location and celebrate the 80th anniversary of the classic game of Monopoly!

This anniversary version of the classic fast-trading property game features tokens from the 1930s all the way to the 2000s! With a retro gameboard and cards, the game takes you back to when it all began, but you still have to build your houses and hotels and see if you can bankrupt everyone else. You better keep an eye on your money, because you never know when the dice will land you with a massive rent bill to pay. Sometimes staying In Jail can be the safest place to be, but only after your properties are primed to make you money. You've got to buy, sell and negotiate to win at this 80th anniversary version of Monopoly!

Features:

 Monopoly game commemorates the 80th anniversary of the fast-trading property game
 Includes tokens from the 1930s through the 2000s
 You’ll buy, sell and trade to win
 Build houses and hotels on your properties
 Chance and Community Chest cards can change your fortunes
 Ages 8 and up
 For 2 to 8 players.

You and your humble lab partner are competing in the 197th Creature Faire. To win this competition, you must rob graves and hospitals for body parts and organs to make your creation. But, don’t get to greedy - collecting extra body parts and organs will make the townsfolk angrier. If they get too angry they will storm the castle. Beware of your fellow competitors also as they can steal from you and anger your mob by spreading vicious rumors.

Be the first to complete your creature and bring it to life with electricity, proclaiming… It’s Alive!
A bowling game where you spin a gyro on a sloping field against the pins

WyrmRider is a 2 player microgame in the one page "postcard" style

Setup: One player places the 3 wyrms anywhere on the 6 spaces on their side of the board. The other player places the 4 riders anywhere on the six spaces on their side. Players may orient the counters in any direction.

Play: Beginning with the wyrm player, each player takes a turn by rotating, moving and combatting.

Rotating - A player may rotate their counter 60° clockwise or counterclockwise.

Moving - The player may then move any counter 1 hex in distance in any direction, maintaining the counter’s current orientation. If the player chose not to rotate a counter they may instead move a counter 2 hexes in distance.

Combatting - After rotating, and/or moving, a player may attack one adjacent piece of the opposing player with any of their counters. A player may only attack in the directions indicated by the red arrows (arrows must point perpendicular to an adjacent hex side). Players each roll one six-sided die, the attacking player gains a +1 to their roll.

If the attacker’s roll is greater than the defender, the defending piece is removed.

If the defender has more than one counter adjacent to the attacking counter and they have lost combat, they may immediately combat once as a new attacker, before the start of their normal turn. The +1 rule applies.

Win: A player wins by moving one of their counters on to the 
opposing player’s home space.

name.value: Star Trek: The Next Generation – The Final Frontier

item.description:
Star Trek The Next Generation The Final Frontier Action Game.

The Ferengi are up to their capitalist ways again. They have overrun the engineering room and are going after the energy matter/anti-matter reaction chamber. They are trying to steal the dilithium crystals to sell on the open market. These crystals are the energy system on the U.S.S. Enterprise. They would secure at least 5000 bars of gold pressed latinum for the Ferengi, and would turn the Starship Enterprise incapable of warp travel. Your mission is to defend the engineering room against the Ferengi and not let them get away with any of the crystals. Your mission is clear...Engage!

PLAY SUMMARY:

Get your scoops ready to catch the Ferengi as they leave the five Jefferies tube openings, as the phasers are pulled from the matter/anti-matter reaction chamber. Catch a Ferengi and get a piece of your Starship Enterprise. Catch the dilithium crystal by mistake and you loos a piece of your U.S.S. Enterprise. Be first to complete your scoring disk and you win.

link.value: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles Tower of Doom

item.description: A combination of War and Slapjack. Players place cards on the table, then duke it our War-style when a challenge card comes up, or try to slap the pile when a Smack It card comes up. Whoever has the highest card for a challenge, or is the first to slap the pile on a Smack It, gets the pile. Players who run out of cards are out of the game. As a twist, eliminated players may slap card piles to remove cards from play completely.

Game description from the publisher:

Treasures of all types — yet the hard part is not capturing the ship's bounty, but dividing it fairly among the pirates! Players take turns splitting each round's booty into shares for the other players. Different types of treasures have different values, and of course there's the hidden items to keep people guessing. Will you be the quartermaster to give everyone their fair share – but giving yourself the best share?

Each round in Booty, cards representing treasures are revealed. Some are worth points immediately, some items cancel others, some give you a chance (but not a guarantee) for a big payday. The quartermaster, a job that travels from player to player, divides the treasures into shares and also includes the order of picking treasures in the next round. Balancing what you need, what others might want, and trying to get a little extra into your treasure pile is the key to success!

The building cards provide many special benefits that allow for a broad range of strategies every time you play.

item.description:
Game description from the publisher:

You know there is money in chocolate, but it doesn't just grow on trees. You need to control the links in the production chain to get your cut of the cash, to make sure the cocao flows through your businesses instead of your competitors'.

Sometimes you need to help your customers and suppliers to help yourself. If you are wily, you can figure out a way for your competitors to do the work for you. Create monopolies, cut off the supply chain, disrupt other players' finely honed plans — do whatever it takes to become King Chocolate.

The fruit of the cacao tree goes through six steps to become chocolate. You can control only a few of these steps, so you must work with your fellow chocolate makers to keep the chocolate flowing through the production chain. It sounds cooperative and friendly — but did we mention that the chocolate maker with the most money wins? Things always get complicated when money is involved.

To ensure your portion of the production process is used the most so that it earns you cash, occasionally you'll help your customers and suppliers. At the same time, you will attempt to crush your competitors, force others to help you, and manipulate the supply chain.

You'll do whatever it takes to become the king of chocolate.

item.description:
COMPONENTS
Base set contains 54 unique Cards, Token Punchboard, the game's Board and Rulebook. The Extended version contains 84 unique cards, as opposed to 54 cards in the regular set.

OVERVIEW
Gomora : Downtown is a Neo-noir card game for 2-4 players. It can be played 1vs1, 2vs2 (co-op mode) or Free for all. The game is for ages 15+ and it lasts 15-45 minutes.

You are a detective in the city of Gomora. You will take a path between good and evil in a corrupt city full of eccentric and controversial characters. Nothing can be taken for granted. Your goal is to try and solve perplexing crimes that implicate multiple powerful interests. Gomora's criminal underbelly is after you....so hurry up detective.

This game consists of 84 cards each with a unique photo-realistic artwork. There are 4 tokens representing the 8 Detectives and a game board with 4 locations to move around in order to find clues and complete your case.

HOW TO PLAY
When your turn starts you draw a card or you store cards under your case. Then you have to move to a different location and play it's ability if you wish to. The third step allows you to play your cards. Alternatively you can rest during the third step so that you recover one life point. After you are done playing cards, make sure to keep only 4 cards in your hand and you turn is over.

PROLOGUE
How did you get here? What did you do? Why are they after you? In the city of Gomora the rules are made by those who rule the streets, and those who govern the masses are in their back pocket. The city is corrupt to the bone. Nothing is clear and no man knows what is true and what is fiction, which is convenient for some. Pacifism is not an option. If you pretend to be “good”, you‘ll probably end up in a ditch, or worse. If you pretend to be “bad”, vengeance will be upon you sooner or later. The only way forward is to lurk in the shadows, stay unseen until the day you’ll do what needs to be done. Believe in what you feel rather than what you see, because in this town nothing is what it seems.
Every day in Gomora is a struggle for survival and as far as I know… today is not a good day for you to die.

Show them what you 've got detective..

STORY
Bloody Sunday 6am.... Agent's Kiran and Mark have just arrived in the crime scene three miles away from Casino Montenegro.
Mark:- Morning Mike...so what’s the story?
Officer Mike:- Good day to you Sir...
Mark:- It doesn't seem like one...but please continue.
Officer Mike:- It looks like this poor guy has been shot several times by a Niner last night. The doc said the hit was around midnight.
Mark:- Any evidence gathered?
Officer Mike:- Not yet Sir. We are still examining the surroundings. Just got here half an hour ago.
Kiran:- Ok then we will be down town taking our breakfast so if you have any news from the morgue or the crime scene contact Gloria in 4237. We will take it from there (Agents walking away).
Deputy Jones: (shouting)- Agent Kiran...!!
Kiran:- Yes how can I help you Deputy Jones (walks towards him).
Deputy Jones:- May I have a word with you in private?
Kiran:- Sure...lets walk.
Deputy Jones:- I have found this note. The guy was holding it but in a way that if somebody placed it there...in his grip.
Kiran:- And why are you giving that to me old friend (smiles)?
Deputy Jones:- Just take a look and you'll understand why (Deputy Jones grasps Kiran’s shoulder).
After a while in the car
Mark:- (after a few minutes of silence) What's wrong man? Come on spit it out... 
Kiran:- It's nothing... Old Jones just wanted to give me some guidelines... Not a big deal.
Mark:- Sure thing...now pass me over that note he gave you.
Kiran:-(surprised) Ok Mark you win....the note was from Fox. I guess we will have to cover that up again....any ideas?
Mark:- (speaks with emphasis) And again she strikes without warning....that crazy b#*@$. 
Kiran:- You know that this will start a war right?
Mark:- This was Viny's little brother there… I am prepared for everything....
